root: ^Want to learn more about CPU Fan?

c-0: ^Alright. A CPU fan is an essential component of a computer's cooling system designed to keep the Central Processing Unit (CPU) cool during operation.
^There are 3 types of CPU Cooling and those are: Air Cooling, Liquid Cooling also known as AIO Cooling or All-in-One Cooling, and last was the Custom Water Cooling.
^Air Cooling is the most common cooling method for CPUs, air cooling uses a fan to blow air over the heatsink to dissipate heat.
^Liquid cooling uses water or a coolant to absorb heat from the CPU, transferring it through tubes to a radiator where fans expel the heat.
^An advanced cooling solution that involves custom-designed loops of tubing, reservoirs, and pumps to cool not only the CPU but also other components like the GPU and motherboard.
^Thanks for understanding what I said about CPU Fans, I appreciate it.
c-1: ^Don't worry about it and take care fellow adventurer.
